TEXT.TEXTVALUE: The materials are arranged inside a laminar air flow chamber.
The inoculation loop is heat sterilized in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner till red hot and allowed to cool for some time.
The lid of the plate with microbial culture is lifted partially enough to insert the inoculation loop.
An isolated colony of the culture is picked with sterile inoculation loop.
The nutrient agar broth labeled “Test” is taken from the test tube rack.
The cotton plug is removed carefully with the little finger of your right hand holding the inoculation loop.
The mouth of the tube is then heat sterilized in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner. The inoculation loop with the culture is then inoculated into the sterile nutrient broth (Test).
The mouth of the test tube is again heat sterilized and the cotton plug is replaced.
The inoculation loop is then heat sterilized in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner.
The incubator door is then opened.
The inoculated nutrient broth (Test) and the uninoculated nutrient broth (control) are then taken into the incubator.
The inoculated nutrient broth (Test) and the uninoculated nutrient broth (control) are then taken into the incubator.
The incubator door is closed and the broths are then incubated at 37 degree Celsius for 24 hours.
After incubation the incubator door is opened.
The uninoculated tube (Control) and the inoculated tube (Test) are taken from the incubator.
The uninoculated tube (Control) and the inoculated tube (Test) are taken from the incubator.

The tubes are then placed in the Laminar Air Flow chamber. The increase in the turbidity of the broth in the inoculated tube (Test) indicates the microbial growth. The absence of microbial growth in the control tube indicates the aseptic working condition.
